summary: This is an email chain between employees of SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions regarding the procurement and shipment of security cameras for a job at MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center). The document is part of the Epstein case data set, suggesting it relates to security arrangements at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

persons.name: Fred Pridemore
persons.context: SigNet Technologies procurement employee who receives and processes an order for security cameras to be shipped to MCC New York.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: SigNet Technologies Program Manager for FBOP (Federal Bureau of Prisons) contracts who authorizes the camera order and provides shipping instructions for MCC New York.

connections.description: Co-workers at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions involved in the procurement process for a federal contract.

events.title: Camera Order Authorization for MCC New York
events.description: Justin Houston sends an email authorizing the order of security cameras for a job at MCC New York, specifying part number changes and direct shipment to the site.

events.title: Order Confirmation for MCC New York
events.description: Fred Pridemore confirms receipt and processing of the camera order for MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies office)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain regarding the procurement of security cameras for MCC New York, the federal jail where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The order was placed by SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, a contractor for the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP).
The correspondence dates to August 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest and during his incarceration at MCC New York.
The email specifies shipping cameras directly to the MCC New York site, indicating security upgrades or maintenance at the facility.
The document is part of the Epstein case data set (EFTA00127537), linking it to the investigation into his death or incarceration conditions.
